Pre-Game Insights: Although Georgia’s first taste of a European Championship finals match ended in defeat, the Caucasus nation got to celebrate their first-ever goal in the competition.
Willy Sagnol’s men may be the underdogs for this clash but they will back themselves to get something from it.
Czechia did not offer a great deal in their last-gasp defeat to Portugal and are now without a clean sheet in five matches.
Willy Sagnol had no injury problems ahead of, or during, his side’s opening clash with Turkiye as Solomon Kverkvelia managed to prove his fitness in time.
The only man unavailable for selection was veteran goalkeeper Giorgi Loria, who picked up a red card from the bench during the final play-off with Greece.
Willy Sagnol dismissed rumours of him leaving for another job, stating he expects to be working for Georgia for 'the next few years'.
Czechia manager Ivan Hašek provided a fitness update on a couple of key players after the 2-1 defeat to Portugal.
Patrik Schick was only withdrawn on the hour mark because he was tracking back so much and beginning to tire.
Tomáš Souček had to undergo treatment ahead of Czechia’s opener but is not feeling any great discomfort and is happy to keep playing.
Czechia have a clean bill of health, but changes may still occur given that Hašek praised Antonín Barák and Petr Ševčík, who both came off the bench against Portugal.
Saturday’s clash will mark the first-ever coming together of these two nations.
Czechia’s defeat to Portugal was only their second time tasting defeat in their last 15 matches.
Clean sheets are an issue for Czechia as they have only two in their last ten fixtures.
Georgia is more familiar with the taste of defeat (six in the last 15), but half of these have been against strong opposition, namely Spain (twice) and Morocco.
There have only been two defeats, including the one against Turkyie on Tuesday, since last October.
Possible Lineups: Georgia (3-5-2): Mamardashvili – Kverkvelia, Kashia, Dvali – Kakabadze, Kochorashvili, Mekvabishvili, Chakvetadze, Tsitaishvili – Mikautadze, Kvaratskhelia.
Possible Lineups: Czechia (3-5-2): Staněk – Holeš, Hranáč, Krejčí – Coufal, Barák, Souček, Provod, Douděra – Chytil, Schick.
Within Georgia, the game will be accessible via 1TV (aka First Channel), while in Czechia, viewers can watch live via Česká Televize (CT) Sport.
In the UK, BBC One is the channel you need.
